body_html: @mskwarek It may be good but most of the c++ projects like opencv, caffe,dlib are already using CMake. So, it's so convenient if tensorflow also officially support CMake, that way anyone can easily integrate tensorflow code to their product without using bazel build to create shared library and copy pasting some includes manually and etc. etc. .
body_text: @mskwarek It may be good but most of the c++ projects like opencv, caffe,dlib are already using CMake. So, it's so convenient if tensorflow also officially support CMake, that way anyone can easily integrate tensorflow code to their product without using bazel build to create shared library and copy pasting some includes manually and etc. etc. .
body: @mskwarek It may be good but most of the c++ projects like opencv, caffe,dlib are already using CMake. So, it's so convenient if tensorflow also officially support CMake, that way anyone can easily integrate tensorflow code to their product without using bazel build to create shared library and copy pasting some includes manually and etc. etc. .
